text:
SHE is mine and Iâ€™m f***ing proud! #SHEisMine
.
I donâ€™t mean to upset you with what I just saw on the news, but this needs to be talked about. A four day old baby girl was found buried alive. She was found by a couple who were burying a child they had lost and heard her cries while digging a grave. She was buried alive because she was born a girl...
.
Tens of thousands of female babies are aborted every year simply because male babies are preferred by culture. This goes beyond unequal wages and the gender inequality we face in our own country, this is a matter of unequal and unworthy of LIFE ğŸ˜­ What in the actual ****?
.
I believe that we are all equals, but in the case where any gender were to reign superior, should it not be female? Just saying ğŸ™Š Without woman, there is no man. Women give birth to men, we gift them their LIFE. Without us, they wouldnâ€™t exist. We birth men. We grow them, WE nurture them and raise them. Thatâ€™s some pretty powerful stuff. How dare my daughter be viewed as â€œless-thanâ€ by anyone or any culture. #WeAreEqual
.
So here I am today, putting this out here because I feel compelled to try and make a difference. Iâ€™m mad, and heart broken. We need to change the world. So letâ€™s do it, maybe we can save some babies. Letâ€™s start a movement â™¥ï¸
.
This is my beautiful, amazing daughter whom I value EQUALLY to my son.
SHE is mine â™¥ï¸ and I am so damn proud to call her mine #EndGenderInequality
.
Will you post a photo of you and your baby girl or just a picture of her today with the same caption as mine? â€œSHE is mine and Iâ€™m f***ing proud! #SHEisMine #EndGenderInequality â€ and join us in our fight for change! ğŸ’ªğŸ¼ Tag us so we can share and spread our message loud and proud, that these GIRLS are OURS and we are effing PROUD! ğŸ˜­â™¥ï¸ @theknottedcrown |#SHEisMineâ™¥ï¸ Even if you donâ€™t want to tag us, please share something! Our babies deserve a voice. These baby girls deserve to be heard.

text:
In 2004, former Plan International Germany Director Marianne Raven was in Nepal discussing the challenges faced by a rural community.
She saw a girl called Sharmila who didnâ€™t have enough clothes on to keep her warm.
When Marianne asked her mother why she wasnâ€™t being cared for, the mother replied, â€œBecause she is a girl,â€ and a campaign was born.
This marked the start of a growing focus from Plan International on the needs and rights of girls that resulted in Because I am a Girl transforming girlsâ€™ lives in over 70 countries.

I personally came across @planindia
In 2014 April that was the same month I got my first salary and wanted to do something more then just spending it on me.
Great Initiative Great cause. I will always support it. â¤â¤â¤â¤â¤ I am not nominating anyone specific but all who can see this post.
#girlsgetequal

text:
Menstruation/Periods.
(How women in countries like Bangladesh & India suffer during menstruation.)
-
Bangladeshi women suffer from menstrual problems such as dysmenorrhea, menorrhagia, light and heavy bleeding during menstruation, and irregular period and are constantly worried if their menstrual flow is not a â€œnormalâ€ amount. They believe that a good menstrual flow is needed to stay healthy. If the flow decreases, they think that they have â€œbad bloodâ€ trapped within their bodies, and if it stops altogether, they are concerned that they may have become infertile. Inability to conceive is viewed negatively in Bangladeshi society and women are subjected to psychological distress by society if they are perceived as infertile. Also, there are many social, cultural and religious taboos surrounding menstruation such as staying away from foods such as fish, eggs, meat, sour fruits, etc during menstruation. Moreover, they are often advised to stay indoors as menstrual blood may attract evil spirits,as well as stay away from their own children and families.Gynecological problems such as those related to menstruation are a major concern among Bangladeshi women, but social stigma and shame stand as a barrier against seeking proper healthcare.Yes why not we stop hating women or keep thinking that they are impure while they are on periods.As @healtheworld19 have said earlier â€œworld would be so much better if we get to understand each otherâ€™s emotionsâ€.Women go through a lot, they just donâ€™t show their emotions.Why not we all stand up for women who's having troubles with their menstruation. Women are heroes,they carried us for 9 months in their womb,brought us in this beautiful world.Then why are we not taking care of them???â€©Spread positivity,happiness joy around the world and diminish hate.Respect Women & their bodies.ğŸ’ªğŸ¼

text:
Today I want to have a one on one talk with you guys. I've been thinking for a while to have raw cconversations. To interact better with you guys. We all have a story that no one knows about. A past we Can't forget. A future we can't predict. Why do we always have to be STUCK IN THE MIDDLE OF NOWHERE. Why are our minds so stuffed up?. To the point we don't know what we're doing. And just with the flow, cuz that's better?. Why don't we find time for what we love the most?. Hang out with people that bring the REAL US out!?. We care too much about others, we care too much about what society thinks of us, we can't let out past go?. and we cant even stop thinking about what our future holds. ALL THESE THOUGHTS ARE WHAT WE ARE STUCK IN!. It's sad how we can't put ourselves first anymore.  If one tries to. They will either get bullied, pulled back, or be judged!. EVERYONE HERE IS HERE FOR A REASON. We are all unique. And we, ourselves need to understand this first in order to know our worth. IF YOU WANT PEACE IN THE WORLD, CREATE IT!.. Why have we stopped supporting each other?. I've so many questions.  And yet all I can do is think myself to sleep.. all these WHAT IFS, and WHYS are stuck with me. 
I want us to not only want better for us, but better for the world, better for the animals, plants, people, ourselves, our thoughts. We need to stay United.  We need to SHOW MORE LOVE. BECAUSE WE ARE ALL EQUAL. I wish I could say much more. And if you would like for me to talk on issues of the world.  I would love to. Just lemme know down below â¤
#STOPBODYSHAMING
#STARTLOVING
#YOUAREPERFRCT
#LOVEYOURSELF 
#EVERYBODYISUNIQUE
#WEAREEQUAL
#SUPPORT
#DONTHATE
#DEVOTIONFIRST

text:
Flashback to last weekends Hastings 10km, being escorted to the line by the event director on the lead bike. He came back for me after escorting the lead man to the finish. I was very happy to receive the same treatment that the winning man received. Itâ€™s a shame the journalist from the local paper decides only the winning man needed mentioning in the race report - you should probably mention the Womenâ€™s winner too right? Women just want to be treated equally. Equal pay, equal distances in sports, equal opportunities, equal respect, equal treatment #weareequal

text:
Be real...
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
I am realizing that people like REALL so much more than posed and perfect. We can spend so much time making our feeds look just right or have the photo edited just perfect but I sincerely believe that the more authentic & real we are the more relatable we are. And the more relatable we are the better people feel. â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
We are all human. We all poop and pee and wake up with morning breath. Seriously. Think about it. Social media can cause us to feel so separated from others, as if we are so very different than the people we are following but we are all the same. We are all equal. â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
So today I celebrate those who show up real. This takes true self confidence and to me this is beautiful...

text:
â€œCommunityâ€ can come in many different forms. This past weekend, I attended a Toyota Motorhome Club rally in Indiana. Going into the event, I really just expected to enjoy conversations around our quirky little RVs, but the depth of character shared amongst attendees was incredibly refreshing. Iâ€™m left reflecting on how we always have a choice: to isolate ourselves out of self-preservation or fear, or to seek out community with a willingness to be vulnerable, open to what it will return. .
.
.
Attendees ranged in age, home-base location, political views, vocation, religious beliefs, lifestyle... I could go on and on if I wanted to focus on our differences, but I donâ€™t. Our differences disappeared when we all met on common ground, sharing knowledge, helping each other to fix this or that on our RVs, communing around meals, and telling spirited stories or singing songs around the bonfire. Over the course of the weekend, I learned as much about these wonderful people- and myself- as I did about my motorhome. We began our three days together as strangers and drove away knowing that we had that many more friends in the world. .
.
.
This isnâ€™t a typical volunteer-centric post, but my experience from the weekend made me realize that one of the most beautiful aspects of volunteering is the equalizing effect it has on those involved in the nonprofit community. When a person approaches a strong community with the desire to learn and contribute, those positive commonalities shadow over individualsâ€™ differences. We can all use a little bit more of that these days!

text: Creativity is the oldest gift in the universe. The ability to observe, experience, innovate, reproduce, and create is within us all. I choose to honor this gift in a number of ways, but primarily through visual art. I think, read, dream, daydream, converse, sketch and paint. I love developing ideas in my sketchbooks and then bringing them to life on canvas. #sketchdaily #operateinyourgift #staycreative #creativeprocess #nativeamericanart #weareequal #equality #studiomojo

text: Often times we focus on empowering #women or #men separately but not often enough we put our efforts to understand both sexes and how women and men have been subjected to different types of thinking and values that are now an issue for the society that we want for ourselves. The same way that women have been mistreated, under-appreciated and used, men have also suffer from the different symptom of a sick society. Instead of taking parts I believe we should educate and understand each other more, support in equal measurements and leave behind the stereotypes that only put us apart. As a kid I didnâ€™t grow up with a male figure, instead my house was full of strong, independent women that tought me #empowerhumans we all deserve it! ğŸ“· @_thatgirlbooter âš¡ï¸#bethechange #useyourpowertoempower #empower #weareequal

text:
To the pieces of @&#*^@#% little high school boys that are talking shit about my daughter behind her back....
Let's be clear that she has earned her spot on the Royals! She has 4 years, 5 seasons, 2 championship games and a championship ring to prove her place. The blue Jersey that she wore proudly today at school was not her boyfriend's, ITS HERS! She actually doesn't have time to date you pathetic immature knobs... because she's so busy earning her spot. 
She has been the only girl on her teams for years, which as any other woman knows that means she's busy breaking a glass ceiling. When you are sleeping in, she's up training, when you go home after school football team practice, she goes to coach another football team. *** Understand this, Sophia has to worked at least 3 times harder than you do, while you question her being on a team because she is female, and dealing with inappropriate comments... and sadly more, so if you feel the need to question if she should be on the team because she is a Girl feel free to message me so we can have a real discussion about if you've earned your place on the team.
ğŸ¤¦â€â™€ï¸
To @sophia__rose66 don't you ever give up, and don't let their words touch you. If anything they are afraid to be shown up by you. I and many others are so proud of you. You are amazing and you are doing amazing things!

It is so incredible to see so many people owning their power and becoming teachers, healers and role models for others In these times of change. However, one has to be very careful not to allow the negative ego to intrude by putting themselves above everyone else just because they have a degree or certification. âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨
We are all teachers AND students. We are here to experience, learn, grow & evolve. Our encounters with others are instrumental in this process and we must always be open to seeing our mirror reflection in those we encounter, allowing others to always teach us something new about ourselves. Every single person on this planet has a special wisdom & uniqueness to offer the world. Be careful not to be led by the egos lure. We are all in this together. We are all equal...here to learn and here to teach in our human experience. ğŸ™

text:
Today is a Great Day! It is also a great time to sit with yourself and make a promise to never neglect your internal self. When you begin to listen to the confusion or pain within you, thatâ€™s when you take control of your LIFE.

Itâ€™s easy to go through Life accepting the uncomfortable emotions we tend to hold inside. Then defending the process of self sacrificing for others and need of being accepted. Iâ€™m fine, itâ€™s ok ... when itâ€™s Not!
The truth is that we neglect the one person that has coped with so much all your life. Has been loyal and supportive at every stage, never abandoned you and yet we easily ignore their distress .  We donâ€™t listen to our internal child... who deals with the BS of others and the decisions based on their needs and wants.
When you value and respect that internal you, the one that is childishly honest and curious for all that LIFE has to offer - you will be stronger and happier. 
Then you are the Best for every person because you will show them what it looks like to be Responsible for the future.  Loving yourself starts by loving the â€˜mini you ğŸ’«â€™ #loveyou #minime #lovingmeunconditionally #notnegotiable #lifeblueprintmyway #divalife #honesty #truth #responsibility #wetoo #theheartofhope #womeninbusiness #teamdivas #balidivaretreat #breatheinlove #nomore #weareequal #inspiration #womenofpower #childrenfirst #lifecoach

text: Look how big these little angels are gettingğŸ¥° Vida and Sasha are thriving and loving life, and are enjoying all the snuggles. We saved these two sisters while bearing witness last month at a livestock auction where they were being sold for sacrifice. Whenever I tell people that story, they look at me like Iâ€™m crazy! What?! People donâ€™t sacrifice animals anymore! Oh yes. Yes they do. In the end itâ€™s really no difference then slaughtering animals for consumption... a living being that doesnâ€™t want to die.. is murdered against their will. Next time you see a rack of lamb or leg of lamb.. this is your lamb. Vida and Sasha. And they want to live. They all want to live and most arenâ€™t as lucky as these beautiful girls. Vida. To live. Sasha. To protect. For the animals. Always. #savedfromslaughter #theirlivesmatter #weareequal #noonewantstodie #ifightforthem #4themiwill #veganaf #animalrights #sharetheirstories #nonprofitforanimals #nonprofit #animalsanctuary

text:
#equality â™¥Today, spontaneously, I joined the Equality March walking down the streets of Katowice for a moment. I was attracted to smiles, happy songs, positive people, and quite sad thoughts. Colorful flags fluttered above their heads, elderly people were on the march, there were children on their parents shoulders, there were dogs, there were mothers with teenage daughters and sons,  grandparents who hold hands, fathers who supporting their children in discovering who there are, heterosexual couples who showing support and the police who took care of the marchers' safety. In my country, one of the equality parades taking place in the summer ended in a massacre - firecrackers were thrown at people, beaten their people, humiliated, threatened with death, spit on them, eggs and glass thrown at them and much more physical harm was done to them. Nobody received any help, on the Internet were congratulated on having beaten an innocent person, and people from the equality parade were prosecuted and harmed. "Man and woman - a normal family" that's such slogans guided are by people with homophobic inclinations, who enjoy beating or humiliating another person because she is  herself or him is himself, and that's all. PLEASE STOP! I joined the march today because a thought appeared in my head - yes, I'm afraid of muscular people shouting their vulgar slogans of extreme homophobic nationalists, but if something is to happen to me only by the fact that I love who I love, it's okay cause it is a sign I don't have a problem. I'm not interested in strangers with their a private life and if I was to be hurt for smiling and singing among cheerful people of all ages, I'm ready for sacrifice. I'm proud of continuous work on myself and specialist doctors made me aware that my orientation isn't a disease or a problem, so I believe them and not aggressive men and women with a strange worldviewâ—

text:
Authenticy. I come from a place where honesty, authenticity and realness was welcomed.  I got a message from a close friend this past week, who just knows me SO well. My own anxieties have come forward as my head is piling up with the do's of the year ahead, the appointments, the schedules ... and before a lot of it begins, I'm exhausted. Speech therapy, feeding specialist, occupational therapy, EEG's, genetic testing. My mind is filling up and I go to release some energy and then this happens.  I'm at the park the other day, where I could tell a social conflict might happen as a younger child approached Wes while he is in his own world <3 I kindly explained that Wes' doesn't talk much to the Dad (and then sat like the helicopter parent I feel I NEED to be) to which he shared his brother didn't either and it was just laziness and once his mom decided she wouldn't take it any longer he snapped out of it ... I HELD MY TONGUE... I get things like this a lot from people.  Another favourite is "well, he will talk one day, it's no big deal" etc.  I feel the need to defend him by sharing ALL of his struggles, as if not being able to communicate isn't hard enough. I am always observing when I'm around friends, I see how much they direct, teach, guide with just their words. Take that part of your relationship away.  THIS TOPIC HAS BEEN A TRIGGER FOR ME FOR SO LONG & usually ends in tears.  So when you're out and about please be kind.  We are all walking a different path and there is nothing more discouraging than to have someone minimize your story. 
Westley has A LOT of amazing qualities, his difficulties don't define him, and they don't define me as a parent.  Westley can spell, he knows all his colours, numbers, can count back and forth and has amazing balancing skills.  Comparison is the thief of joy âœŒï¸
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#childdevelopment #childdevelopmentspecialist @cv.cda #loveyourkids #redefineperfection #specialneeds #letthembelittle #weareequal #myson #myfamily #speechdelay #speechdelaytheraphy #smartkid .
.

Thinking of you. ğŸ’•|Kindness is everything ğŸ’|â¤ï¸|I had no idea you were going through such a difficult time.  I will be praying for you and your family.  I will do my best to always be kind.|That picture is beautiful and so is that beautiful boy. I know from my interactions with you all that you are raising your children with love, and that is what matters most.|ğŸ’ You are doing amazing with Westley, thank you for showing us a bit of what you go through and how it effects you. ğŸ’|I understand completely how frustrating it can be to minimize the difficulty our child have, and not allowing them to define our kids.  Even with Sam as an adult, on her own, she still struggles and I still get â€œshe is just lazyâ€ itâ€™s hard since I donâ€™t even live in the same country, but she will find her own way.  I had to learn how to pray through it and allow God to lead.  Please know I am praying for your family @jacklynszabo â¤ï¸ and Wes will do amazing things with love and support from you guys!|He is a HAM!!

text:
Look at this beautiful boy ğŸ¥° Ruckus the sheep is indeed a mommas boy! My work week is coming to a close and I am ready to be home with the babes! Sometimes being in the service industry.. like any job.. is challenging. But it makes me soo appreciative for the life I get to live and the souls I get to share it with when I get home! I will literally pull up the driveway and starting hugging every baby I see! And they all neigh, nicker, baaa, squeal, bark, meow.. you name it.. when they hear my truck. It takes any negative that may have happened at work.. and makes it disappear. What is everyoneâ€™s favorite part of their day? Do you guys have family members(fur or human) that brighten your day??
If you missed it! Our first visitor day will be September 28th from 1-4pm! If you would like to join us for this intimate gathering.. and meet the animals and humans of HHHH, please dm me ğŸ¥° You all rock and make my day better every day! I read through all the comments when I get in bed at night and it puts a smile on my face when I fall asleep â¤ï¸ #happyhearthappyhome #ruckus #ruckusthesheep #animalsanctuary #furfamily #theymakemyday #mypurposeinlife #farmanimalsanctuary #animalsarebetterthanpeople #weareequal #veganforlife

text:
"Setting boundaries doesn't make me mean." I can set limits and expectations for my life and still be "Nice".
Considering your wishes doesn't mean I have to do, what you think I should do.
My feeling and thoughts are part of my decision. 
And if you don't like it, that belongs to you. "Forgive, but guard your heart until you see a sustainable change".

text:
Sabato Ã¨ successa una cosa meravigliosa! Il mondo ha bisogno di notizie cosÃ¬, soprattutto la ns Italia!
SarÃ  un caso proprio che una FAMIGLIA ARCOBALENO abbia dato vita a un gesto di uguaglianza e solidarietÃ  vs il diverso? Io non credo!
Io preferisco condividerlo oggi che stanno iniziando a parlarne meno perchÃ© Ã¨ una carezza al cuore che non va dimenticata â™¥ï¸
.
Grande merito a DesirÃ¨ Nica <3
.
.
===
L Italia quella bella, oggi ve la racconto io da Trapani
.

Sono le 13.00, e arriva sulla spiaggia uno dei tanti ambulanti che cercano di vendere qualcosa.
Solo che stavolta Ã¨ donna
.
Solo che stavolta Ã¨ mamma
.

Ha una cesta enorme che tiene in bilico sulla testa, con dentro tutto ciÃ² che vorrebbe vendere, e dietro, legata sulla fascia, la sua bambina.
AvrÃ  2 anni e mezzo, 3 al massimo. Sta sotto al sole in groppa alla sua mamma mi chiedo da chissÃ  quante ore
.

Subito mi sento in difficoltÃ 
.
Guardo mia figlia e penso che sono 3 ore che mi affanno per farle scegliere cosa mangiare, per coprirle la testa dal sole, per stare attenta che non beva acqua troppo fredda.

Dico a Gabri che vado a comprare qualcosa da quella mamma e che vado a portare un po' di frutta fresca alla bimba e darle qualcosa da mangiare
.

Ma non c'Ã¨ stato bisogno di fare niente
.

PerchÃ© oggi l'Italia bella Ã¨ stata quella delle mie vicine di ombrellone che tutte insieme hanno detto a quella mamma come loro, di andare a lavorare tranquilla, perchÃ© alla sua bambina ci avrebbero pensato loro
.

Ed Ã¨ proprio cosÃ¬ che Ã¨ andata
.
La mamma ha continuato il suo giro per le spiagge, e la piccola ha mangiato insieme a tutti i nostri figli sotto l ombra del ristorante dello stabilimento, ha giocato sulla riva, ha fatto i gavettoni insieme agli altri bambini della spiaggia
.

E io oggi sono felice, perchÃ© Ã¨ stato davvero bello vedere tutto questo â¤ï¸
=== #famigliearcobaleno #love #liberamentemamma #gestidamore #weareequal #family

You deserve the same love as everyone else.
Your worth is not defined by what youâ€™re doing, but your being.
.

.

Be more compassionate towards
ourselves and each other
.

.

.

.

.

.

.

.

.

And the list goes on.
.

Every day we have a choice to think, feel and act from a place of hostility or a place of love.
.

.

I choose love!â¤ï¸
.

I think it's funny when people ask me why my style changes from either masculine/feminine or wonder who is the dominant in my relationship. I use to get offended but I brush it off. I decided a long time ago that I would not define myself to labels and love all aspects of femininity and masculinity. I also was lucky to find a partner who feels the same and let's me be who I am and understands we are equal in every way.

text:
Happy Womenâ€™s Equality Day! We love this message from @britandco founded by @brit Morin. Young women need to see take-charge women in all areas of society. BE A LEADER.  Our future depends on it. (Image by Brit + Co)â 
â 
Why do we celebrate Womenâ€™s Equality Day on August 26th? On August 26, 1920, Amendment 19 was finalized:â 
â  â€œThe right of citizens of the United States to vote shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of sex. Congress shall have power to enforce this article by appropriate legislation.â€â 
â 
This first voting rights hurdle was huge. But donâ€™t forget that this was only extended to white women. Women of color did not get the right to vote until 1965, 45 years later. While we have made gains over the years, we have a LONG long way to go. â 
â 
Hope you join us today in celebrating #womensequalityday by doing something to advance women. Whether it be advocating for a womenâ€™s group, mentoring a young woman, or simply being vocal where you see inequality, every little bit helps. While it may be cliche, â€œIndividually, we are one drop. Together, we are an ocean.â€â 
â 
Need suggestions? We are loving the message over at @equalitycantwait started by @melindafrenchgates  See some ways to take action at https://equalitycantwait.evoke.org/actionâ 
â 
This is not a sponsored post, just real admiration for those passionately advocating for the advancement of women. â

text:
today is #nationalwomensequalityday 
on this day, in 1920, women were finally granted the right to vote. .
Lucretia Mott, Elizabeth Staton, Martha Wright, Mary Ann McClintock and Jane Hunt are to thank for setting this fight in motion. they began the battle for the right to have a voice in 1848, and 171 years later we are not only able to vote, but run for office as well. .
womenâ€™s equality has come so far, and there is still a fight to fight. iâ€™m still not able to walk alone at night without fearing for my safety, i carry a small knife on my key ring because i feel i have to and my voice still gets lost amongst the voice of men. .
letâ€™s continue to fight for true equality. not women above men, or men above women, but equals. fair rights for both and equal opportunities. .
.
.

text:
I am a proud vegan and understand that all animals and humans are equal. 150 million animals are being killed every day for our selfish race! You wouldnâ€™t eat your dog or cat and sheep, cows, pigs and chickens are no different! You wouldnâ€™t drink your wifeâ€™s milk so why an animals! They all have feelings and they feel emotional & physical pain like us so why would we continue to torture & murder them when we can get all the nutrients a human could ever need from plants. Itâ€™s all a no Brainer to us and people that choose to remain brain washed are only fools to themselves. Not only are you hurting, killing and eating living things but your also killing yourself. text: Growing up, I assumed life would be easier if I pretended I was the same as everyone else around me. I didnâ€™t want to focus on the things that made me different â€” on my appearance or the surgeries I had to have. Instead, I compartmentalized my experiences. I tried to convince myself I was the same as everyone else, because maybe if I forced myself to believe it, everyone else would too. But Iâ€™ve spent the last few years coming to terms with my differences. And for some, it may be annoying that I talk about my appearance and my facial difference so much. But for me, itâ€™s the most liberating thing in the world. To be able to say â€œthis is me. Take it or leave it,â€ and go to sleep each night okay with who I am feels like a miracle. I spent so many years drowning in the weight of who I was (more about that in my book). Living unapologetically is freeing. And Iâ€™m only at this point now from writing and sharing my story â€” from connecting with others who have had similar experiences to mine. All of this is to say that there is so much beauty in living authentically, in being different. Whoever you are and whatever your story is, be you. Shine your light. Speak your truth. Let your freak flag fly. Because even if you donâ€™t believe it now, thereâ€™s a whole community of people out there waiting to love you.

they say they seem to be perfect enough to continue to judge. we should try to be together in the situation they are in, then we can look at all the angles. when they are in a negative environment, we should bring them out in a positive direction.
talking and judging is easier than exploring and understanding the situation. each position has different angles and not everything will work out the way we expect it to.
they are already stressed enough in their efforts to improve their steps and strengthen their role. not only do they have to face great opposition but they also face an uncomfortable situation.
if you cannot accept failure or lack of trust, simply dismiss the complaint. do not let it go to your heart, and at the same time judge it to be a bad judgment and to create a gap between you.
stop right away, we are the same .. just different places and ways. but judging one another is not our nature.

text:
Yes, more of these voices please. We should never forget we are equal, we are one. .
Posted @withrepost â€¢ @helprefugeesuk Pia Klemp, the German ship captain who rescued migrants in the Mediterranean, as she refuses a medal from the mayor of Paris: "I'm not a humanitarian. I am not there to 'aid'. I stand in solidarity. We do not need medals. We do not need authorities deciding about who is a 'hero' and who is 'illegal'. In fact they are in no position to make this call, because we are all equal.
"What we need are freedom and rights. It is time we call out hypocrite honoring and fill the void with social justice. It is time we cast all medals into spearheads of revolution!
"Documents and housing for all!
"Freedom of movement and residence!"'
- Pia Klemp, 20 August 2019

text:
I introduced you to Marialuisa from @migaswimwear yesterday. Now today, I want you to introduce you to the third member of our proposed @SXSW panel on Disfigurement as Identity. Meet Nathalia, the motivational speaker and self love advocate behind @lovingmydots ! Nathalia was born with #nevus â€” a non-genetic birthmark that covered 40% of her face in addition to the moles, or satellites, all over her body. From the time she was 9 months old until the age of 13, Nathalia had many surgeries to remove her facial Nevus. And in 2018, Nathalia started sharing her story on social media as a body positive advocate. She now gives motivational speeches to help others build self-esteem too! Iâ€™m so grateful to have connected with Nathalia and hope to attend #SXSW with her and Marialuisa next year. The three of us are so passionate about #disfigurement and #visibledifference . I know Iâ€™ve been talking about SXSW quite a bit lately, but there is only ONE MORE DAY left to vote for panels. So please help us bring our stories and message to a larger audience by visiting the link in my bio and voting for us. It only takes a second to register and â€œvote up.â€ Thank you for the love and continued support as we work to spread awareness. Because every face and every body is beautiful and perfect just the way it is. â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

text:
âŒWhat it means to look different??âŒ
.
We live in a world that we are what you look like. Whether you have visible differences or not, you are constantly judged by your appearance and that has to change!ğŸš«
.
That is why we want to bring this subject to #SXSW with our panel! Tomorrow is the last day to VOTE! Please VOTE UP for us - Link in BIO! ğŸ—³
.
Meet @arielhenley who I will have the pleasure (hopefully) to be on the panel with along @migaswimwear at South by Southwest.ğŸ’›
.
Ariel Henley is a writer with Crouzon syndrome. After dozens of surgeries that altered the appearance of her face, she grew up in a world that insisted on defining her by a face she didnâ€™t even recognize. As an identical twin, Ariel grew up not only experiencing the impact of this treatment firsthand but witnessing it as well.
.
Sheâ€™s written articles about disfigurement and facial difference for outlets like The New York Times and Teen Vogue. She is also the author of A FACE FOR PICASSO, a forthcoming memoir about her experience with disfigurement, which will be published in winter 2021. By telling her story, she hopes to help eliminate stigma, educate others about the importance of facial equality, and promote mainstream inclusion for individuals with physical differences.
.
.
.

text:
PLEASE READ AND TAKE NOTICE.

Last night Paul Pogba witnessed Racial Abuse throughout the whole match. This is absolutely disgraceful to see that this kind of hatred is still around in the world of football, not just inthe world of football but in life in general. And how many times that these low lifes have to hear no matter what the colour, religion, or nationality, we are all the same. I hope these sick people realise how much damage they are causing to families. We should give them as  what i call a taste of their own medicine. They have to realise and come to conclusion that the world has changed, they need to learn that equality is a thing not a word. Some people say that "oh we have to move on be strong", but what they're basically doing is that they are letting these trouble makers who think this is entertainment to take over us , and make us all enemies. We stand with Pogba.
#weareunited
#weareequal
#wearehuman
#weareone

text:
Real men ARE feminists. Why shouldn't they want equality? The stigma that feminism only helps women is utter crap. Men need equality too. We all want equality. The idea of equality and feminism is so simple. 'Genders being treated equally'. Yet this message isn't being translated. People think that Feminist isn't a good word. But it is. People think men can't be feminists. But they can. I have a good friend who agrees that women should be equal to men but doesn't want to be a feminist because feminists are extremists. When they aren't. These all annoy me so much but the core anger behind each refusal to feminism is stereotypes. So all you other feminist accounts are doing such an amazing job. Carry on!
.
.
Via @feminist.aus .
.

text:
Listen, dear... Everyone has the same amount of time during the day. Each of us handles it in their own way. The way I manage my time let me travel the world and reduce the stress. The way others do it let them have happy families or win the championships. And I accept that.
.
The way I decided to spend my freetime,
as well as the way I express myself are different than yours and may be different from your expectations. It doesnâ€™t make me a stupid person. ğŸ˜‰ We just have different lifes.
.
The fact I denied meeting you doesnâ€™t make me a stupid person. I know 4 languages, I have been to 34 countries, in 5 I lived. I saw a lot in my life. My EQ is well developed.
.
We have different roles, different priorities, different circumstances. Maybe you met me 2 years ago but I am a different person now.  Iâ€™ve grown and moved on. 
There is still so much to see in this world! Who has time for dramaqueens?ğŸ˜‰ .
Explore the world and be kind to each others. You will see more. Peace! âœŒğŸ¼#lovefirst #bekind #nodrama #truthğŸ’¯ #weareequal #respectyourself

This is the story of pride ! 
WAIT ! where are you running ? 
Because now there's no place to hide.
Dear society, recognised us ? 
Yes ! We are PRIDE ğŸ’ 
Earlier we believed, that history owes an apology to us for letting you all mistreat us from the start. We were down there, under your feet ; Struggling yet United âœŠLife has been a beautiful struggle. It still is. Why ? Let us tell you a fun fact ! 
You know what even harder than waiting for a bill to pass ? Changing This Societal Perception. Life, Healing, Sunlight, Nature, Harmony and Spirit is what we are made of...colourful just like our flag and just like any other human we deserve Love, Kindness, Acceptance and Respect because we are no less... WE ARE EQUAL ğŸ¤âœŠ

text:
â€œBeauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.â€
- Kahlil Gibran.
.
Saw this in the loo at a restaurant the other week. They have this message instead of a mirror.
.
Thank you @labaraccabali - you made me stop and reflect.
.
If I was 100% happy and at peace with myself... Would I need to stop and check that my hair is okay?
.
No.
.
(Maybe this is why many great spiritual masters shave their heads? ğŸ˜‚... @radhanathswami @srila_prabhupad)
.
A nice reminder that Iâ€™m already enough.
.
A nice reminder that we are all, already enough.
.
A nice reminder to try and see the beauty in everyone I meet.
.
And, a nice reminder to try and treat everyone equally.
.
Itâ€™s easy to forget that behind this material illusion, we are all the same.
.
We are all lost, divine souls, trying to find our way.
.
Love
.
#wakeupneo #youarebeautiful #lostsouls #weareequal #harekrishna #maya #love #radanathswami

text: Every night before bed Ruckus comes up to me for pets and snuggles. When we rescued Ruckus and Bella, we also saved Ruckusâ€™s sister Stormi, who passed away from pneumonia. The night she passed away my heart hurt more then anything for Ruckus, cause he knew his sister was gone. I stayed up all night with him and my mom came to sit with him the next day. Iâ€™ll never forget him nuzzling her body, wanting her so badly to get up. I still get choked up thinking about it. But in return I got the most beautiful relationship with Ruckus and Bella and that I am so forever grateful. Animals are just like us, only different. text:
Trying to get a picture of both of them is a game in a half lol. What funny boys these two are. They are such huge pieces of my heart and soul. Has anyone else had trouble this summer with the 100 year storms that keep hitting? I have lost more grass and seed this year due to flooding, amongst other things that we have resorted to feeding more hay then an average summer. It cost us about $175 a week for hay right now and winter it doubles! Due to last weeks storm, a portion of our driveway got washed away, and needs to be fixed this week before any more water damage can occur to our property and surrounding houses. This is an added expense we were not planning for, and if we could raise the money to cover this weeks hay bill, it would be a huge weight lifted â¤ï¸ A hay bale is $6, and we need 30! Every $1 adds up and means the world to all of us here at the Happy Home! Fingers crossed tomorrowâ€™s storm is nothing like it has been ğŸ¤ğŸ¤ğŸ¤. Thank you for believing in our journey! We couldnâ€™t do this without you all! And remember all donations are tax deductible!! VENMO: HHHHFR24
PayPal: https://www.paypal.me/Laurenrosborough #sanctuarylove #cowappreciation #steer #moocow #vegansforanimals #hay #hayday #nomorestorms #fundraiser #taxwriteoff #nonprofit #animalsmakemehappy #heartandsoul #cownoses #hamilton #oatmeal #farmsanctuarylife #farmanimalsanctuary #weareequal #alllivesmatter #vegansonamission #vegan #notyourmilk

text:
ğŸ•‹
Pic of my son & I leaning against the Kaaba. I am hovering over him to shield him from the crowds. His head is shaven bc we had previously completed our umrah pilgrimage.
ğŸ•‹
The Kaaba is a cube-shaped building in Mecca around which Muslims circumambulate as part of pilgrimage. It is covered in a specially made black cloth, called the kiswa, decorated with Arabic / Islamic calligraphy. Getting to touch the Kaaba is a particular blessing, especially one corner of it holding the black stone.
ğŸ•‹
Currently millions of Muslims are gathered in Mecca for the annual Hajj pilgrimage. During this time Muslims follow the footsteps of prophets & pious predecessors, such as Abraham and his wife Hagar, by performing certain rituals.
ğŸ•‹
Tomorrow, 9th of #dhulhijjah, is the greatest day of the Hajj when they will stand on the plains of Arafah and beseech their Lord with countless prayers & tears.
ğŸ•‹
Muslims all over the world will also pause on this day to reflect, pray, & worship, as it is one of the holiest days of the year, even for those not in Mecca. It is an important day to fast, as it absolves the sins of 2 years, the previous & the upcoming.
ğŸ•‹
That is also the day that Prophet Muhammadï·º gave his farewell sermon, detailing critical advice for his followers. Swipe to read all of it - 2 excerpts below:
ğŸ•‹
To the men: â€œIt is true that you have certain rights with regard to your women but they also have rights over you. Remember that you have taken them as your wives only under Godâ€˜s trust and with His permission. If they abide by your right then to them belongs the right to be fed & clothed in kindness. Do you treat your women well and be kind to them for they are your partners & committed helpers.â€
ğŸ•‹

The result demonstrates how beautiful diversity can be and just as the rainbow, it teaches us to embrace our own differences and the differences of those around us.

text:
2 years ago I decided to remove as much negativity from my life as I could. 
So I could focus on my happiness and leading a positive life. I decided it was time to invest in me !! Step one .... STOP INVESTING IN PEOPLE THAT DONT INVEST IN YOU ğŸ‘Š

All types of relationships should be a two way street. 
When we invest in others we give them our time and when we learn that our time is valuable we stop giving it away.

Stop asking how someones day is going when they dont first ask you.
Stop making time for people, when they dont make time for you.
Stop being present with people, who are not present with you. 
Always remember your worth !! No one is first or second in a relationship - We are only equal ğŸ™Œ

P.S Follow this man @thematthewhussey and thank me later â¤ğŸ‘Š

text:
**Please read for explanation of these videos**â£
â£
While traveling around Northern Thailand this past week, I had the opportunity to visit some elephant camps. Iâ€™ve been thinking a lot about how to present the information I learned and the photos/videos I took in a way that would not only point you toward more hands off ways of viewing elephants but also help to see elephant tourism/handling/care as a scale, more so than seeing it as black and white. So Iâ€™ve decided to split this story up into a couple of posts. For this post I just want to explain what â€œstereotypyâ€ is in captive wildlife, because thatâ€™s a really important part of assessing psychological health and welfare. â£
â£
The term stereotypy describes behaviors seen in captive wildlife that are abnormal (aka wouldnâ€™t be seen in the wild). These behaviors often come about due to lack of stimulation (barren or inadequate environment), strict schedule of feeding or the restriction of food, inability to socialize, close contact with humans, and are used as a coping mechanism for stress. These are behaviors that an individual uses to reduce its stress; a good human example would be biting nails, fiddling with hair, pacing, tapping feet, etc.

As you can see in these videos, these two individuals show severe stereotypy. Swaying, trunk swinging, rocking, pacing, aggressive trunk flicking, these are all stereotypical behaviors that the individuals are using to cope with something that is causing stress. â£
â£
Now, I know this looks bad. But just so everyone understands in full, many many many elephants show stereotypical behaviors in one way or another. Not just in camps where they are in small enclosures and being ridden, but also in sanctuaries (which is a big part of the research Iâ€™m doing). Management cannot necessarily stop these behaviors completely, but does have a major impact on frequency and severity. â£
â£
.â£
.â£
.â£
â£

text: If youâ€™ve experienced an abusive or traumatizing relationship, you know the feelings of shame, regret, self-blame, and judgment of others. Iâ€™m not proud of it, but I used to be a person who judged women who were in abusive situations. â€œWhy donâ€™t they just leave?â€ â€œIâ€™d NEVER allow a person to treat me that way.â€ I made assumptions about the type of woman who found herself in relationships with violent, manipulative people (weak, unintelligent, no self-worth, lesser than). Itâ€™s shameful to admit but itâ€™s true. Now Iâ€™m one of those women, and Iâ€™ve met MANY others on this leg of the journey. And I can tell you first hand that it is SO much more complicated than that. Every women Iâ€™ve connected with who has suffered and survived an abusive relationship is a beautiful-hearted, compassionate, kind, SMART, Loving, resourceful, and strong human being. People who are abused tend to be trusting and open, which make them often easy prey for abusive and manipulative personalities. We donâ€™t EXPECT people to hurt us, we see the best in people, we believe in Love and the ability of a person to grow and improve themselves. People who are abused are some of the kindest, most Loving souls. I know this now. Iâ€™m grateful for the lesson. Iâ€™m grateful for the authentic connections Iâ€™ve made through all this. Someday I dream of meeting in person all the women who were ever victimized by the man who hurt me, looking into their eyes, and embracing them in a hug that Iâ€™ll hold as long as they want me to. I feel so much LOVE for these women, and for every person whoâ€™s been through something similar. There are a LOT of you out there. For everyone else, think twice before you judge someone in a situation that you know nothing about. Until you have walked anotherâ€™s path, you are ignorant and cannot speak to their choices or their experience. And like the picture says, weâ€™ve all done things in our lives for which other people can judge us. Whatâ€™s that bible verse... pull the plank out of your own eye...? (Yeah I know it. Just reminding you to think about it.) A good practice is to check yourself every time you start to place judgment on someone else â¤ï¸

text:
Ich lebe nun seit mehr als einem Jahr vegan und Ã¼berlegte lange ob ich etwas aus dem Trailer von #dominion posten sollte. In diesem einem Jahr fÃ¼hlte ich mich oft ausgegrenzt und verurteilt. Wie kannst du nur Vegan Leben? Es gab und gibt nur eine Antwort: Ich will nicht dass ein Lebewesen fÃ¼r mein Leben leiden muss! 
Dominion war der ausschlaggebende Punkt. So drastisch. So konsequent und so ehrlich zeigt keine Dokumentation, wie sehr wir nicht nur unserer Welt schaden, sondern auch Tiere foltern, quÃ¤len und hinrichten. Nur um zum Abendbrot das Brot mit Salami zu belegen und zur neuen Netflix-Serie die GummibÃ¤ren zu verschlingen. 
Ich stoÃŸe immer noch auf Unwissenheit und Intoleranz, weil viele denken, dass ich jedem zum Veganismus zwinge. Ich zwinge niemanden, aber ich bin ein Mensch. Und als Mensch habe ich eine Aufgabe. Die Wahrheit zu zeigen. Dominion zeigt die Wahrheit. Und deshalb hab ich mich entschlossen wenigstens einen Teil vom Trailer zu zeigen. Mittlerweile gibt es den Film auf Deutsch. Kostenlos! Auf YouTube! 
Vielleicht halten mich wieder einige fÃ¼r verrÃ¼ckt, aber das ist mir egal. Wenn nur eine Person sich diesen Film anschaut, bin ich stolz auf diesem Post. Entscheidet selbst:

Link zur deutschen Fassung von Dominion:
https://youtu.be/V7DrljVAaYk

text:
We label people like they are merchandise, to be sold at auction - but we are not objects to class, to store away in drawers to make life easier... If we have to put a label on everyone, we better have 8 billion, because there is one unique name for each...
It doesn't matter the color of your skin, the person you love, the god you pray, or the nation you pledge allegiance to - that defines why you can and cannot become... The only limit to your freedom is that of which you set... Do not allow the labels society was built on determine your tomorrow - be who you want, be who you please...
We should all work together not against one another as the challenges that await are not one of a select few, but ones that concern every han living here, from the old to the young, for the boys and girls, for the rich and poor, everyone is concerned... The environmental disaster that's upon us doesn't care for borders, for wealth, for age nor ideology, it is affecting us every second... If in this time of crisis, we still see humanity and animals as merchandise and objects, then we are in no way "wise men - Homosapiens" but are still neanderthals... #humanproblems #humanright #humannature #human #humanity #crisis #environment #education #change #voiceforchange #lifequotes #standup4humanrights #wearehuman #weareequal #photography #church #wakeup #progress #quotesaboutlife #motivation #inspiration #urbanphotography #urban #history

I know that because I donâ€™t fit the typical stereotype of a girl who likes girls has made it difficult to find a girl. Many times Iâ€™ve tried talking to girls and have been rejected because I â€œdonâ€™t look gay enoughâ€ or they â€œdonâ€™t trust bi girlsâ€ which I donâ€™t think is fair. I find the LGBTQ+ community deals with enough discrimination, and I donâ€™t think we should be doing it to each other! I think we need to work on including our own community more before we can be mad at others for judging us as well.â€ â€¢

text:
The day is foggy here in Berlin.
I call a @uber and the uber driver was very fast. I enter in the car and 10mts after we start his working, we were stop by the police because he just open the window and press a button in the car panel. The @polizeiberlin argue he was one the phone doing a call. He wasn't! 
They stop the car almost 15minutes during my way back to airport and they were rude. Other uber cars pass through us, pressing the phone buttons and the polizei didn't act. 
I told them that the guy wasn't on the phone and we try to show them the uber record. And you know what? They told me to fuck off because they didn't care. Isn't their problem. 
Interesting point: Bassam, Uber driver, is from Palestine and having a big beard with shaved head, like me (I've less beard).
Sum up: berlin police send me to fuck off just because I ask them if we can move forward because I have a flight? Really? This how you approach people that don't talk German? Why you have biased people doing this job, jeopardizing who are working just for free? 
@Uber you should understand how your drivers in Berlin are losing money and customers because the Polizei stop the cars when the drivers accept the travel orders.
#uber #polizei #berlin #palestine #dontbebiased #equalrights #weareequal #humanrights #instapic #picoftheday #german #fightracism

text:
Most of my posts deal with food or baking but the larger world affects me and us. I was walking over the last weekend and angrily rehashing the Presidents latest tweet storm aimed at citizens of the USA (and the world) who he deems as less than human. 
How should one respond to these comments? How does a citizen with no power respond meaningfully? We MUST speak out about racism and dehumanizing comments and when I saw this collection of flags proudly showing the inclusion of the â€œotherâ€ I could not help but take image and want to share #nomoreracism #nomorediscrimination #weareallhuman#stopthetweets#nohatehere#supporteachother#loveislove#endracismnow#acceptance #rainbowflag#rainbow#pride#endracism#nomoreracisttweets#enough#weareequal#equalrightsforall#iphonephotography #whatisee#whatiponder

text: This world would be so much better if ppl could only open their eyes into matters that really count. Last night i stressed my mind out about how miserable i feel when i see how ppl lost their paths, their dignity, their dreams. You should stop going by the trend and make your own path. This cruel misconceptions and internet viral stuff takes out all the humanity left inside of us. Ppl are so busy to run after popularity, money, followers. In the end of the day none of this will actually stay with you or make you feel  peaceful. Ppl forget so easily they used to be simple, they run after succes like its some kind of status that permits you to live in here. Wake up, you have been born with the right to live your life and you are already succesful without being some kind of millionaire or popular vlogger bla bla. Internet opened so many of way for ppl who doesnt even have any talent or life experience to make themselves â€œpopularâ€ just by making fun of trivial stuff and blind brains actually like it cuz so thatâ€™s the trendğŸ˜ª. If you want something nice in life start to treat yourself nice and take care nicely of the ppl around you who actually care about even when u are nothing . I learnt you cannot achieve true succes without working hard or fight truly for what you believe in. You donâ€™t need to compete with others cuz your place is already yours anyway. The world makes us turn our back on each others when love and compasion should be the key in surviving better and get along..start appreciate more of what is fragile and unique and strong not what ppl make fun of or show the others through their phones. Beside that full account of cool pictures etc most of them are empty and have nothing to offer to anybody. Selfish people will never get it in the end..this is our ruin right now..everyone think is better than someone else but in the end we are all equal! #hateloverelationship #mikachu #thought #mylife #advice #world #wise #appreciatelife #iexist #worldwide #betterlife #itsuptoyou #change #model #lost #weareequal #thoughtsinwords #instaquote #modelinseoul

text:
Mental health in itself is a taboo for many  and for especially for men accessing mental health help or even express their feels seem against cultural expectations. However, slowly we are trying to break the chain of stereotypes and stigma.

On July 28, 2019 we had a wonderful experience with our campaign on â€œMen's Mental Health Awareness:-#MardKoBhiDardHotaHai~ Boys Do Cryâ€ for which there was great participation from all walks of life and appreciation to highlight the issueğŸŒŸâ™¥ï¸ We are thankful to @raahgiri_day to support us every time ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ Here are some snippets of our AWARENESS WALK; the PLAY focusing on emotional blockages in various stages of life which ultimately effects the mental health faced by Men as well like pressure of being the only breadwinner with no say to their career, gender stereotypes, stopping from expressing, frustrations, aggression etc.; FLASH MOB to help motivate the audience to give chance to grow healthy; ACTIVITIES conducted post-play focusing on breaking the stereotype of expressing their feelings; and ending on a positive note through a POETRY written and recited by team member! 
A huge congratulations to the each and every member of team MANSA for the appreciation by the audience who lend an open mind and positive words to spread more awarenessâœ¨ğŸ’ #MANSAforMentalHealthAwareness 
#Speakout #Reachout #Endthestigma
#mardkobhidardhotahai  #MensMentalHealth #mentalhealthforall #mentalhealthawareness #campaign #gurgaon #raahgiri #fightforemotionalexpression #weareequal #wearehumans #letsupporteachother

text:
Hey my loves, just your overly nice transfemme drag dumpster fire checking in to let you know I'm done being sweet and kind for no reason. If you shit on my family, friends, or ANYONE FOR NO FUCKING REASON OTHER THAN YOUR BIGOTRY, I'm gonna call your ass out. I watch too many people get shunned, hurt or killed for being themselves. I'm not about to let a cis white gay man degrade a member of my family because you don't see the value (financially or even as a human) of the person you are choosing to take a shit upon.

We fight for acceptance too. Just because you can survive in this world without too many questions doesn't mean you can start being part of the problem. Don't forget, white cis gays are still "less than" to many people. 
I'm still a sweetheart, shit on me. Cool, I'm a big girl. I've lived through worse. But my community, my FAMILY are entitled to respect. And I will fight and bleed till they have it in equal amounts.

text:
Is it just me or does it seem like everywhere we look on social media we are told we are in need of self improvement and that we should surround ourselves with high value individuals who share our beliefs and goals (even though last I checked, we were all equal)? From what I can tell, this mostly results in a society where we are all reinforcing each other's point of view and patting each other on the back for being really amazing.

This has made me think about my personal goals for self-improvement. I will strive to always keep learning from every single person I encounter, new activity I try and each moment in general and to be as grateful, kind, generous, empathetic and happy as possible while I do it... oh, and to avoid anyone who refers to themselves as a high value individual at all costs. ğŸ˜‰
comments: |#weareequal #selfimprovement #donttakeyourselftooseriously #personalgrowth #randomthoughts #sunset #beautifulbc

text:
Education is a fundamental human right.
No matter our origins, our color, our orientation, our financial situation, our social situation - having access to school, to a place of knowledge is essential for the development of a stronger youth, of a stronger society, ready to combat the problems we face together as one...
Having access to these locations is not a privilege and not should this ever become the case, it is a right for all humans to go to school and learn what they want... It is a priceless right... Much like food and water, housing and electricity... How can we seek a unified society if we cannot allow those who walk tomorrow the opportunity to analyze yesterday to build tomorrow... Education should be accessable to all, free for all - no matter the education course, and be of the upmost quality to ensure that we give all the keys to our future... It doesn't matter if your a child from the top 1% or one who had to flee a warzone, you are entitled to the same quality of education... This is basic human rights, and should not be a question or a concern in the first place... It is time to change our views and start giving the keys to our young to help us find solutions to our problems that plague our everyday life... #education #raiseyourpencil #human #humanright #standup4humanrights #inclusion #everydayactivism #weareequal #together #help #knowledge #sdg #sdg4 #globalgoals
comments: |Totally agree. Education allows the formation of critical thinking that is important to guarantee the rights of everyone. ğŸ’ªğŸ‘ŒğŸ˜Š

text:
We are ALL equal. No race, gender, sexuality, religion, belief or background is greater then the others. Everyone is equal. Everyone deserves a good and happy life. We are ALL human beings with families, friends, beliefs, memories, and lives of our own. Why is it so hard to understand this? We all breathe oxygen, require food and water to survive, want companionship and love. We are emotion filled human beings who respond to our surroundings in a good or bad way. We are all equal. It pains me to see such ignorance from people who have so much hate in their hearts. I just wish that more people were able to love one another instead of having such envy and hate.
â˜†~~~~~~~~~~â˜†
Sending blessings and love to everyone who reads this whether you need it or not ğŸŒ¿ğŸŒ™ğŸ”®
â˜†~~~~~~~~~~â˜†

text:
Kindness is more than deeds. It is an attitude. An expression. A look. A touch. It is being conscious of your moves and how it affect other's thoughts and feelings. It is anything that lifts another person. Whether they deserve it or not. Choose it. Choose kindness. It is unconditional. It doesnt expect anything in return. Kindness is Love. #choosetobekind #kindnessmatters #bekind #choosekindness #justlove #loveandkindness #always #beautifulinandout #giveittoall #donotdiscriminate #weareequal #ingodseyes #ingodseyeswereallthesame .

text:
I love that we all fly through this crazy awesome life a little differently. That we are all unique and wonderful in our own perfect way. I love that if I donâ€™t let my mind get involved and just stay true to my own path that my flight feels so much more full and vibrant. That judging based on what everyone else is doing doesnâ€™t make it better. In fact it hinders my progress. To just let myself fly! Try it. Try doing a pose, a climb, dancing or anything you feel like doing and pretend like no one is watching. Just do it for you! Way different!!
ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ
Itâ€™s a practice....
ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ
Iâ€™m not saying that we canâ€™t seek inspiration from others. It can be quite inspiring to see what others are up to...however,  it is important to honor ourselves and our own path.  Listen to ourselves..deep inside. To allow ourselves to find our own way. To be happy where we are..we need to learn to love ourselves for who we are and love everyone else for their awesome unique rad ness too. Then we can work together to make some really cool things happen! Seriously!..
ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ
Happy Monday everyone!! Happy journeys! .
.
.

.
.
.
.

text:
BOOM ğŸ™ŒğŸ¾ğŸ‘ŠğŸ¾ COMMUNITY is essential. However we must be mindful of where we seek support and how we identify what we are looking for. We often choose to seek connection from those unable to provide it to us when we are needing to heal parts of ourself. When you heal you are able to develop healthy affirming connections and recognize them when they are present in your life. ğŸ¦‹
ğŸ¦‹
Reposted from @trauma_conscious_yoga_method (@get_regrann) -  The process of decolonizing my healing personally has included my remembrance of the truth and return to the practices of my ancestors. As a therapist, trained in the West, I had been persuaded that those who were "attention seeking" or "needy" - meaning needing external validation from society or their community, had some form of pathology. This aligns with our societal ideology that champions rugged individualism, competition, capitalism, and all the other isms. This however, is bullshit. .
Our brains and bodies are wired for tribal survival, community support and community validation. We need this. We thirst for it. We struggle to show it to one another in the West. And many of us are sick, lonely and hopeless because of this lack. .
Our ancestors survived in tight-knit, intimate, spiritually-driven community and each individual's purpose was validated and nourished. So fuck the idea that we are "attention-seeking" or "needy" if we desire what is innately human. .
Question what you know. .
#decolonizemyhealing #transformingthelegacy  #intergenerationaltrauma #racialtrauma #collectivetrauma #ancestraltrauma #historicaltrauma #resiliency #healing #yogaandsocialjustice #traumaconsciousyogamethod #blacklivesmatter #peopleoftheglobalmajority #dismantlethepatriarchy #dismantlewhitesupremacy #dismantleheteronormativity #weareequal #weareone #wakeup #woke #blackyogateacher #blackownedbusiness #blackwriter #yoginigofcolor #BIPOC #community #validation - #regrann

As a therapist, trained in the West, I had been persuaded that those who were "attention seeking" or "needy" - meaning needing external validation from society or their community, had some form of pathology. This aligns with our societal ideology that champions rugged individualism, competition, capitalism, and all the other isms. This however, is bullshit. .
Our brains and bodies are wired for tribal survival, community support and community validation. We need this. We thirst for it. We struggle to show it to one another in the West. And many of us are sick, lonely and hopeless because of this lack. .
Our ancestors survived in tight-knit, intimate, spiritually-driven community and each individual's purpose was validated and nourished. So fuck the idea that we are "attention-seeking" or "needy" if we desire what is innately human. .
Question what you know. .

text: I try not to tell people I meet for the first time Iâ€™m vegan, because I donâ€™t want them to immediately judge and stereotype me, because it has happened a lot before. Also, I donâ€™t think animals are people. Animals have feelings like us, but no they canâ€™t really do all the same things, but thatâ€™s alright and they still deserve respect. Killing isnâ€™t a personal choice, because the animal never volunteered to die to be eaten. Free will is something you have to willing choose though. Still if you arenâ€™t vegan, I donâ€™t think Iâ€™m better than you. All humans were created equally and I believe we all have dignity that canâ€™t be taken away regardless of who we are and where we come from. #vegan #veganmemes #health #environment #ethics #yourchoice #govegan #notapersonalchoice #love #animals #stopanimalcruelty #veganism #veganmemes #weareequal #equality #animalsdeservebetter #animalsarefriends #friendsnotfood

text:
ğŸ‡These aren't ordinary grapes. These grapes are very special. You see, these grapes took 11 years to come to fruition, and they are a sign of the amazing things about to happen. ğŸ‡ 11 years ago, my dad and I decided to start a winery. He went to school and I bought land. And shortly after, I became deathly ill, went through an nasty divorce with a broken man, and sold the land. ğŸ‡ 5 years ago, my (new) hubby and I decided to revive my dream on his family land. We put up a fence, started buying plants, and had our friends teach us more. Then the distance between my house and my MIL's house became too short, and once again, we moved and gave up on my winery dream. ğŸ‡ Three years ago on a trip to a winery, we impulsively purchased this plant. As Shabby Chick grew, I knew my winery was years away. And still is. ğŸ‡ These grapes are a sign. It's harvest time. I have worked hard and long. I have carefully prepared myself; growing and stretching myself; never giving up. Not death, not illness, not hate, not doubt, and not sabotage has been able to keep me down for long. I believe we reap what we sow. I believe we choose our destiny. I believe my dreams are about to come true. I love the woman I have become and I deserve what is heading my way. ğŸ‡ What are your dreams? What are you doing to make them come true?

text:
#throwback to last Monday, when I conquer my 25th #highpoint!! Contrary to popular belief, #bearmountain is the highest summit in #Connecticut, but not the actual highpoint! To get to the highpoint, one must hike the #MountFrissell trail in #Massachusetts, hike to the summit, and then descend on the south slope to get to the marker on the state line. At this marker is CTâ€™s highest point at 2,379ft. (~725m)! You can also take the trail an additional half mile to get to the tri-state marker between NY, MA, & CT! A total of 3 miles (~5km) RT & 1,000ft. elevation gain should not take longer than 3 hours to complete!! Although the trail is lined with mountain laurel - CTâ€™s state flower - the overgrowth on the trail makes it difficult to navigate at times. 25 states down (NC GA MO SC AL MS VA TN AZ FL LA IL IN OH KY AR KS OK NM TX NH VT NY MA CT), 25 to go!!!!
.
As I try to do with most of my trips, I reflect on how grateful I am to have these opportunities! Unfortunately, this took me to the site of the deadliest grade-school shooting in US history. 27 people lost their lives at #sandyhook back in 2012. Funding for a permanent memorial is  in progress, but I hate to see us become so desensitized that we forget we have the power to prevent more of these atrocities from happening month after month, year after year! RIP little ones.
.

text:
Reposted from @erinmyluv -  This is something I haven't talked about yet but it's time i share our story because we aren't alone. We are often judged on first impressions, categorized as a "special needs" family & often we are seen differently. We fight along side of many others to prove that people with all different abilities belong with & are equal to their peers. But something just as important to us is the undocumented human rights of people & families just like us. We are just one family out of millions going through this.
This is our reality & so many others who don't have a voice. This past January Pablo left for work just as any other typical day. What we didnt know was ICE (immigration) was watching our apartment in search for someone else. Because of that they profiled Pablo, he was followed to work, stopped, and taken into custody. Yes he is undocumented & yes we had already been in the process since Elena was born of applying for his permanent resident card, but its definitely not a easy fast process like many think. We are thankful to our family & friends who called me early that morning to tell me what was happening, because of that our attorney was able to act fast and intervene in the process of deportation. Though Pablo was released that night in an agreement with ICE that he participates in a program. ISAP is a way of immigration to "keep track " of undocumented people while they are fighting there case and still being deported. The rawness is that he must wear a ankle bracelet and is tracked every step he takes. Let me say, Pablo has been here in the US for 19 years, longer than the time he spent in Mexico. This is his home, this is where he, like most people, want to stay and work and be with his family & watch his kids grow up. We are one of the lucky ones, he is here and we got to go back to our life as best we could for now. We get to enjoy having our family together as it should be. But there are many others who aren't as lucky.

text:
This is something I haven't talked about yet but it's time i share our story because we aren't alone. We are often judged on first impressions, categorized as a "special needs" family & often we are seen differently. We fight along side of many others to prove that people with all different abilities belong with & are equal to their peers. But something just as important to us is the undocumented human rights of people & families just like us. We are just one family out of millions going through this.
This is our reality & so many others who don't have a voice. This past January Pablo left for work just as any other typical day. What we didnt know was ICE (immigration) was watching our apartment in search for someone else. Because of that they profiled Pablo, he was followed to work, stopped, and taken into custody. Yes he is undocumented & yes we had already been in the process since Elena was born of applying for his permanent resident card, but its definitely not a easy fast process like many think. We are thankful to our family & friends who called me early that morning to tell me what was happening, because of that our attorney was able to act fast and intervene in the process of deportation. Though Pablo was released that night in an agreement with ICE that he participates in a program. ISAP is a way of immigration to "keep track " of undocumented people while they are fighting there case and still being deported. The rawness is that he must wear a ankle bracelet and is tracked every step he takes. Let me say, Pablo has been here in the US for 19 years, longer than the time he spent in Mexico. This is his home, this is where he, like most people, want to stay and work and be with his family & watch his kids grow up. We are one of the lucky ones, he is here and we got to go back to our life as best we could for now. We get to enjoy having our family together as it should be. But there are many others who aren't as lucky.
#DontLookAway #FamiliesBelongTogether #LightsForLiberty #standupforwhatyoubelievein #love #weareequal #closethecamps #togetherwestand #nohumanisillegal #thisisus #unite #stopseparatingfamilies #downrightperfect #worldchanger #worrier

Its happening all around us, your neighbor, friend, the person in line behind you. Kids are in cages, people and children are dying. I know we are not alone but let me tell you that there were many nights and sometimes still I felt alone. Preparing in my head how to tell my kids daddy is living someplace else. How to go on with our life missing the only one who understood our true family routine. Stand up for human rights. Stand up for what you believe in. Stand up for love. Children don't belong in cages. Stop separating families. Close the camps. No more raids.|I love you guys!! And many people judge without knowing what itâ€™s like to being in our shoes living in fear everyday. text:
Article 26 Everyone has the human right to education including free and compulsory elementary 
education and human rights education.

It's hard to understand for someone like me who has had the privilege to grow up in Finland well known for its good education system that in many other countries education is not a guarantee. Especially not for girls... I guess that I just have to accept and understand that I cannot fully understand. Not now, not after. We can try to understand as good as we can but I think it's important to admit that no matter the facts, we can never argue that we fully understand another human's growth and life. Whether you have grown up in the same country, same city or even same family. Don't you think? 
Thank you @christina_noor__ for posting this human right and for letting me draw you! ğŸ™ğŸ’• #womensrightsmatter #educationmatters #girlsrights #treatgirlsright #righttoeducation #educationiskeyğŸ”‘ #girlsrightsarehumanrights #fuckinjustice #humankind #weareequal #nomatterwhat #peoplearepeople #letgooffear #prejudices #facingyoumanity #stÃ¶rstavalltÃ¤rkÃ¤rleken #drawdrawdraw #drawart #peace #muotokuva #beginnerart #frihet #freedom #rÃ¤ttvisa #rÃ¤ttighet #fairness #jÃ¤mstÃ¤lldhet #equalityforall #womensrightsarehumanrights #humanrightseducation

What makes me equal to the person next to me? What makes me equal to a person in another continent? What makes me equal to a person that belongs to another religion? What makes me equal to a child? What makes me equal to every human being in this planet? .
Our smile. We all smile in the same language. We donâ€™t need words to smile, we donâ€™t need money to be able to smile, we donâ€™t need to believe in God, or to be a specific gender. We can all smile and itâ€™s the best way to communicate with other people.  The smile opens the heart.
.
.
.

text:
MLK was a true leader, one who believed violence was not the answer and who explained in a speech why the founding of this country is important to EVERYONE .
.
Martin Luther King - July 4th, 1965
.
...â€I still have a dream this morning: (Yes) one day all of Godâ€™s black children will be respected like his white children...... .
.
â€œWe hold these truths to be self-evident that all men (All right) are created equal, that they are endowed by their Creator with certain inalienable Rights, (Yes, sir) that among these are Life, Liberty, and the pursuit of Happiness.â€â€
.
Thank you to MLK and those throughout history who have led with kindness and grace. I share this dream and hope it will one day be realized. I continue to have hope for this country on this Independence Day 2019.

No body wins when we throw shade at each other. 
We only succeeded when we honor [our] journeys, honor [our] path, honor [our] obstacles, and EMBRACE what lies ahead. 
Our lives are each our own; we own them by how we choose to act & react. 
By leaning over someone elseâ€™s flame to smother their fire, your flame does not grow brighter. 
None of us are perfect and the ego is strong, but each time you reflect and choose to do no harm, to follow YOUR truth; youâ€™re one step closer to finding some of those good energy vibes that will allow your flame to burn bright and strong. ...

text: ğŸ¤¬ My whole life, I've heard, "Girls can't do that!" "Women don't act like that!" And "What will people think?" ğŸ–ï¸At the ripe old age of 14, I traveled 1500 miles from Montana to Alabama to attend military school. By choice. I wanted more. I wanted a better education. Military school in the 1990's wasn't always kind to the 10% female population. We didn't have female uniforms, female sports, and at times, being a girl was something I needed to "overcome." ğŸ¤  My son recently turned 14, and the generational lapse struck me. I now reflect differently on this time period. I'm reminded that I am so very brave. Seriously? What kind of kid WANTS to go to military school 1500 miles from home? Me. Me who is brave. Me who set out 25 years ago to build the life I wanted. Me, who leaps at opportunities. Me. ğŸ˜‡ I'm so grateful for the leaps I've taken in my life, even the ones where I smacked the ground on impact. I have failed many times, but I am satisfied knowing I've leapt more than I've failed. I'm grateful I never cared what people thought. I'm grateful I was brave. â™¥ï¸â™¥ï¸ What brave thing have you done? â™¥ï¸â™¥ï¸ #survivor #metoo #momboss #momlife #womanownedbusiness #womenempowerment #madeinoklahoma #authentic #ownit #thefutureisfemale #sisterhood  #weareequal #cleaning #cleanhouse #laundry #cleanliving #greenlife #farmlife #greenclean #bestself #believe #changeisgood #betterliving #natural #pure #honest #livelaughlovelife #boss #mom #womanstyle

text:
We all have the power to reset the world  one heart at a time. We have the power to believe and to creat our world a better place.All it takes is to look at humanity like you would yourself no money no objects will make others better than you. Look at the world through the eyes of love and give others the ability to do the same.

There will always be negativity in the world as everyone walks on their own journey, yet my job is not to fall in to it. My job is is to support, encourage and lift those that cant help themselves when they need the most.

text:
â™¥ï¸Hi! Let me introduce myself and tell you why I do what I do! My name is Amber Malcom, recovering Attorney turned natural product maker (now manufacturer). âš–ï¸ About a decade ago, I became ill- I mean 10% chance of survival ill. Over 72 days in the hospital, 12 major operations, and 5 years of recovery, I finally starting getting better. I started taking accountability for my own body. I was on gobs of pills and I really didn't want to rely on them. ğŸ My handsome hubby, affectionately known as Shabby Hunk, and I wanted a "natural as possible" lifestyle. We began to research, bought a farm, and started homesteading. We raised our own food, learned to make all sorts of stuff that I thought grew in stores, and set about getting rid of unnecessary and unhealthy chemicals. ğŸ¡ I started remodeling our old, dirty farm house- The cleaners' stench would run me out of the house! So I started buying "green" cleaners, only to be unsatisfied. I hate Cleaning, I don't want to do more work. So I started making my own. I had 2 criteria for every invention: 1. It MUST work better than my toxic cleaners; and 2. It must be 100% natural. ğŸ† 4 years later, my products have been clinically tested to out preform leading brands; are still 100% natural; we have been featured on the Home Shopping Network, won the Small Business Association's Entrepreneurial Success Award, the InnovatHer Women in Business Challenge, and the SCORE Small Business Championship. ğŸ¤— Hang out with me and I will encourage you to do amazing things with your life too!
