text:
Took this photo July 15th 2016 and Iâ€™m not sure how I feel that this statement is something we are still trying to bring awareness to or understand as to why itâ€™s so easily tossed out the window.
.
Colors aside: We are all humans.
.
âœ–ï¸We are all equal in the fact that we are all different. We are all the same in the fact that we will never be the same. We are united by the reality that all colours and all cultures are distinct & individual. We are harmonious in the reality that we are all held to this earth by the same gravity. We don't share blood, but we share the air that keeps us alive. I will not blind myself and say that my black brother is not different from me. I will not blind myself and say that my brown sister is not different from me. But my black brother is he as much as I am me. But my brown sister is she as much as I am me.âœ–ï¸- [@cjoybellc]
.
On this day, July 4th, when we talk so much about freedom and independence, letâ€™s also remember the many that donâ€™t have that same liberty, in the US and around the world, simply by the color of their skin. When in fact, we are all human and should be treated as such.
.
#MaestroShowUpToBlowUp #day4 @themovementmaestro

text:
Till today with my experience I have never found a person happy with his/her body who got teased by somebody earlier. Sadly, it's the most in our country that every person is treated with bias for their natural body type. Every fat girl that is teased for her being fat, how she feels trust me nobody has a clue. That â€œperfectâ€ body that models have to have in order to be a model proves our obsession with zero figure. Don't believe me? This is how people refer fat people- an elephant, potato, couch and so many other names. If you call somebody with such names and think this is funny then do you have a count of how many times you have put somebody down, played with somebody's self-esteem, made somebody cry.You might not feel the biggie in being called with such terms BECAUSE it doesn't affect you as you're not fat. In TV serials no guy wants to date a fat girl and fat people are always shown binge eating, lazy, eating junk, foodie and you will rarely find any romantic scene of a fat person romancing,because of it the insecurities that people have with their bodies is disheartening. People still trying to find a diet that can change their size.
(CONTINUE BELOW)
.
.
.#bodyshaming #feminism #fatshaming #skinnyshaming #wordpower #writer #neverless #weareequal #dark #fat #skinny #stereotypes #society #mindset #feminist #equality #equalrights #weareallequal #youandmeareequal #neversettle #awareness #positivity #pride #public #standupcomedians #body #mybodymychoice #bodypositivity #liveandletlive #insecurities
comments:
|Being comfortable in your body is not easy, because people will make you notice 20 different reasons why your body type is less appealing and you should change yourself, but they will never tell you even one reason that they find appealing about you in real because WE humans cannot survive confident people around us, we only get confident when others are less confident than us and that makes us a superhero because we can outshine the less confident people in the crew. I'm fed up of seeing people taking supplements to get fat and saying we're trying to be healthier. Lol, who are you making fool, me or yourself? If you wanted to be more healthy you would exercise, eat healthy, lead a healthy lifestyle but no you're taking supplements on which slogans are very healthy such as â€œweight gainâ€. Do you know what's the mentality of a fat girl, that insecurity and fear in her mind while passing a group of judgemental people, there's a constant fear in her mind that at least they don't make fun of me today. I feel so sorry for myself to be a part of such generation who think making fun of people's body is cool. Unless and until it doesn't happen with us it seems cool to us and the minute it happens we feel disrespected. Being fat or skinny is not a problem but when people call us with such terms we feel offended, even if we're comfortable with our bodies because they say that to offend you, to put you down and when someone says something to put you down you feel disrespected. There can be two different people calling you fat but with different intentions, somebody saying it WITHOUT the intention of putting you down and somebody saying it to put you down. Just because somebody is skinny doesn't mean they are malnourished and just the way if somebody is fat doesn't mean they don't let others eat their part. It's high time that we raise the standard of our jokes and stop saying rubbish about other's body. It's their body so their concern, they should be the ones worried about it every time and not us, I don't know what pleasure we get by putting out the obvious things about them with hard hitting words.|Do you know fat individuals are married less often than normal weight individuals. Also, assumption of somebody's personality and traits based on their bodies is wrong(i.e he/she is fat that means they are lazy, they exercise less often). Teachers in school without any hesitation make fun of fat students. In one survey, preschool children reported that average size children are given more preference in plays, lead roles, dance performances.
Statements like â€œshe's too fat to be an actressâ€ why size should be our consideration in an actor/actress? and why not the acting abilities. Fat girls are often told not to wear short dresses, bikini, tops because their curves will make them look odd and everyone's eyes would be on them for that reason.
Statements like â€œshe's too lucky, she got married with such handsome groom even after her being fatâ€ shows our stereotypical thinking for fat bodies. Also, we should report ads like â€œpehle mein mota tha tab meri zindagi dukhi chal rahi thi mera koi dost nahi tha phir maine xyz khaya jisse mai mota hogaya aur ab mere dost haiâ€ pisses the hell out of me.|Also, the subject of stand up comedians our always fat/dark. They say all the offensive and harsh things especially to this category of people. Just because you're falling out of content doesn't mean you will say anything in the name of freedom of speech. All the speakers either they're poets or even stand up comedians, their words have an IMPACT. There are a lot of things about which Indian Janta can have a laugh, so try something new, targeting a category of body is extremely bias of y'all who do this. Also, In schools teachers perceive that fat individuals work more poorly compared to average weight students in the first look and give lesser attention to fat children. A national survey found that individuals who are overweight reported a three times higher livelihood to be denied medical care than the average weight people. They are hired less often for jobs, they have greater termination rate than average weight individuals. Their psychological health also suffers:
they have lower self esteem, lower self concept, higher rates of depression and anxiety disorder, suicidal thoughts and what not. Weight based teasing associated with higher rates of binge eating and unhealthy weight control such as fasting, self induced vomiting,diet pills, skipped meals and smoking.|I don't endorse being unhealthy but I definitely can't support people making fun of a category of body for having a laugh because I don't find it to be funny, I don't understand people encouraging their closed ones to change themselves to be loved by the world. Fat is also aesthetically beautiful, sexually attractive, you should draw fat people, you should see fat people, you should date fat people, you should desire fat people because fat people are beautiful and worthy and NORMAL and they too deserve to be termed as attractive and desirable. They don't need to change themselves, we need to change our mindset. People who think fat people are the most unsuccessful, hopeless, weak willed, lazy people are themselves that way, because they are so lazy that they're not allowing their thinking to grow and a person without growth is weak willed and unsuccessful and therefore hopeless.
What can we do to stop body shaming?
Confront the people who perpetuate body shaming, and tell them that others have feelings too and they also feel bad. As I always say it's just the role of thinking, if you want to see beauty in sombbody you will find beauty ( like her smile is so beautiful) and if you want to find somebody ugly you will notice ( oh, god her face is filled with pimples, marks and what not.) IT'S JUST THE ROLE OF PERSPECTIVE.|ğŸ’|Yess ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ ğŸ”¥

text:
Nina Cried Power is such an inspirational song, I highly recommend it, it's not only about standing up for what you believe in but the power of voice and how strong ones words can be. 
Hozier has inspired so many people with their powerful lyrics and lite up the world with his hit song: Take Me To Church.

The music video for Take Me To Church was surrounding a gay couple. The sad lyrics followed with the performance in the video showed the struggles of being openly gay and opened the eyes of our youth to how mistreated and unwelcomed the SAGA community is. 
Nina Cried Power and Take Me To Church are definitely my highest recommendation as songs to listen too along with many of Hozier's songs.

#music #Hozier #represent #protest #gayrights #loveyourself #standup #saga #freelove #humanrights #weareequal #peace #powerofmusic #freedom #equallove

text:
Life can be as sour as milk in a sippy cup left in a car in July. (Gross) 
As a wife, mother, and small business owner, life can get overwhelming. I've been down over a week  post surgery, and my personal life...yuck...there's some not fun stuff there. (Think 9 day laundry pile)

Sometimes I cry when I'm alone. Sometimes I get really down. Sometimes (a lot of times) I'm too hard on myself. But it's okay. I'm learning to cry it out and then get a plan. 
My feelings are real and just that- feelings. I'm learning every day to look around and pat myself on the back for what I've done right! It's similar to an exercise in gratefulness. Instead of listing all the things I've done wrong, I list all the things I've done right. 
This helps so much with my mom guilt. Everything  gives me mom guilt. One thing I do right for my family is using safe cleaning products. I pat myself on the back because (even if I forgot to feed the kids breakfast) I know that the cleaning products I use are powerful for me yet safe for them. 
How do you move past your own self criticism? What do you do to relieve mom guilt? 
#momboss #momlife #womanownedbusiness #womenempowerment #madeinoklahoma #authentic #ownit #thefutureisfemale #sisterhood  #weareequal #cleaning #cleanhouse #laundry #cleanliving #greenlife #farmlife #survivor #metoo #greenclean #bestself #believe #changeisgood #betterliving #natural #pure #honest #livelaughlovelife #boss #mom #womanstyle
comments: |yes, mom guilt is real! I often ask my husband if he thinks I'm, or we, are good parents, and he always says "if you have to the presence to ask that then you know that you are" and I try to apply that to mom guilt as well... you're already balancing a lot on your plate, no need to add guilt on top of that.  everyone is doing the best they can and as long as the kids are happy and healthy, all is good ğŸ’•|â™¥ï¸|I think itâ€™s good to feel the feelings. They are valid and it helps me to just go with the emotions. And then reflect on all that you accomplish every single day! I hope things get better for you soon - Sending all kinds of positive vibes your way! â¤ï¸|I think we can all relate! It helps to focus on being grateful for the things that are good. Being alive, kids are healthy and knowing that hards times won't last forever. Be encouraged ğŸ’|I can definitely relate itâ€™s so important to celebrate your wins big or small , and allow ourselves to feel vulnerable when times arenâ€™t as pleasant Iâ€™m hoping July will bring a much needed positive shift ğŸ’•ğŸ˜˜|I totally agree, mom guilt is real!  But I think most of it is self imposed.  We are all doing the best that we can.  I used to feel guilty for not being a Pintrest mom.  But my kids where taken care of, happy and healthy.  Trust me they didn't care of I was the "perfect" mom, they loved me anyway.  Geaux easy on yourself, you are doing a great job!  And don't let ANYONE tell you any different.|Wow! What an uplifting quote and story. Thanks so much for sharing!|Always keep it real|Love this story!ğŸ™Œ

text:
Today's Affirmation:
We are all Human!

To me personally this is a very loaded statement. It's not secret the America's history is deeply woven with discrimination. We have no reason to hate another group of people for existing. 
Black? Human.
Hispanic? Human.
White? Human.
Straight? Human.
Gay? Human.
Transgender? Human.
Man? Human.
Woman? Human.
Child? Human.
Christian? Human.
Muslim? Human.
Celebrities? Human.
Our idols? Human.
Our parents? Human.
Our teachers? Human.
We are all human. We all make mistakes. We are all just trying to make it through this life. And we all like to think that we know more than we do, or that others know more than they so. Embrace the imperfections of being human, and remember and everyone is trying to figure out it just like you. Be kind, be loving, and lift other up on their journey!
We are all human!
